testCases.explanation: 3 appears 2 times out of 3 elements, which is more than n/2 = 1.5.
2 appears 4 times out of 7 elements, which is more than n/2 = 3.5.
Single element is trivially the majority element.
1 appears 2 times out of 3 elements, which is more than n/2 = 1.5.
3 appears 2 times out of 3 elements, which is more than n/2 = 1.5.

description: Given an array nums of size n, return the majority element. The majority element is the element that appears more than n/2 times. You may assume that the majority element always exists in the array.
